Class EmployeeController

java.lang.Object
com.example.lab9.controller.EmployeeController
@RestController @RequestMapping("/lab9/employees") @CrossOrigin(origins="http://localhost:5173") public class EmployeeController extends Object
REST controller for managing Employee entities and associated operations. Provides endpoints for CRUD operations on employees and managing orders created or updated by employees.

      Retrieves an employee by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the employee
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity containing the employee or an error message

      Creates a new employee.
      Parameters:
      employee - the employee to create
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a success message and the employee ID

    • deleteEmployee

      @DeleteMapping("/delete/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> deleteEmployee(@PathVariable Long id)
      Deletes an employee by their ID.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the employee to delete
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a success or error message

    • addOrder

      @PostMapping("/create/order") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> addOrder(@RequestBody Order order)
      Adds a new order.
      Parameters:
      order - the order to add
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a success message or an error

    • updateOrder

      @PutMapping("/update/order/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> updateOrder(@PathVariable Long id, @RequestBody Order updatedOrder)
      Updates an existing order.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the order to update
      updatedOrder - the updated order data
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a success message or an error

    • confirmOrder

      @PutMapping("/confirm/order/{id}") public org.springframework.http.ResponseEntity<String> confirmOrder(@PathVariable Long id)
      Confirms an order by setting its status to COMPLETED.
      Parameters:
      id - the ID of the order to confirm
      Returns:
      a ResponseEntity with a success message or an error
